record.dc:title: 41RH41 Hampton Farm Site 86RH41, Rhea County, Tennessee. Burial 86RH10, Deep circular slightly kettle-shaped burial pit in cross section. Lines etched. Intrusive from Stratum II (lower). Sq. 20R3. Direction north-northeast.
record.wpa:narrative: This burial deposited in a very deep symmetrically circular pit with sides that slope inward toward the top. The sides near the bottom round to a slightly rounded bottom. The pit was sunk into the compact sand sub-strata. Preservation was poor, partly because of the depth of the pit probably. The individual, if an adult, would have to have been very tightly flexed to fit into the confines of such a pit. This seems to be the case, judging from the very fragmentary remains.
record.wpa:comments: Observer illustration on file at the institution. See also photograph 69RH41 [fhm01648].
